title: Dejah Mulipola
text:
Dejah Monique Mulipola (born February 19, 1998) is a <a href="Polynesian%20American">Polynesian American</a>, former collegiate All-American, medal-winning <a href="Olympic%20Games">Olympian</a>, <a href="softball">softball</a> <a href="catcher">catcher</a> originally from <a href="Garden%20Grove%2C%20California">Garden Grove, California</a>. She played <a href="college%20softball">college softball</a> at <a href="Arizona%20Wildcats%20softball">Arizona</a> from 2017-2021 and had been named a Second Team and First Team All-<a href="Pac-12%20Conference">Pac-12 Conference</a> player. She was also twice chosen a National Fastpitch Coaches Association First Team All-American. She played for Team USA since 2019 and helped them win a silver medal at the <a href="2020%20Summer%20Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a>. Mulipola was drafted fourth overall and currently plays in the <a href="Athletes%20Unlimited%20Softball">Athletes Unlimited Softball</a> league.
University of Arizona.
Mulipola began her career for the Wildcats setting personal bests in <a href="hit%20%28baseball%29">hits</a>, <a href="double%20%28baseball%29">doubles</a> while also leading the team in <a href="triple%20%28baseball%29">triples</a>. On February 19, Mulipola used a double and <a href="home%20run">home run</a> to knock in a career best 6 <a href="runs%20batted%20in">RBIs</a> to run-rule the <a href="Boston%20College%20Eagles">Boston College Eagles</a>. In a loss to the <a href="Utah%20Utes">Utah Utes</a> on April 14, she had a perfect day at the plate with four hits for another career highlight. As a sophomore Mulipola was named a Second Team All-Pac 12 performer, leading the team in triples, walks and fielding percentage. In a run-rule victory against the <a href="Texas%20Longhorns">Texas Longhorns</a> on March 4, Mulipola walked 3 times for another career high.
Mulipola achieved First Team All-Pac 12 and National Fastpitch Coaches Association <a href="All-American">All-American</a> citations. She was also named <a href="NFCA%20Catcher%20of%20the%20Year">NFCA Catcher of the Year</a>. She had career highs in home runs and walks. Mulipola helped the Wildcats return to the <a href="2019%20Women%27s%20College%20World%20Series">2019 Women's College World Series</a> for the first time since 2010 before being eliminated by the <a href="Alabama%20Crimson%20Tide">Alabama Crimson Tide</a> on May 31. She had two hits including a home run in three games at the series. 
In her redshirt senior season, Mulipola earned First Team honors from the conference and NFCA. She was also named a finalist for the Honda Softball Award. She set career highs in <a href="batting%20average%20%28baseball%29">batting average</a>, runs batted in and <a href="slugging%20percentage">slugging percentage</a>. On February 25, Mulipola hit her 50th career home run, a grand slam off Reggie Kanagawa to run-rule the <a href="BYU%20Cougars">BYU Cougars</a>. From April 18–May 8 she had her best hitting streak at 10 consecutive games. She hit .428 (12/28) with 9 RBIs, two home runs, three doubles and 4 walks before being shutout by the <a href="Oregon%20Ducks">Oregon Ducks</a>. On May 22 to defeat the <a href="Mississippi%20Rebels">Mississippi Rebels</a>, she became the 12th wildcat to join the 50 home run 200 RBI list by collecting 5 RBIs to reach the 200 milestone. Mulipola made her final collegiate appearance in a loss to the <a href="Florida%20State%20Seminoles">Florida State Seminoles</a> on June 5 at the <a href="2021%20Women%27s%20College%20World%20Series">2021 Women's College World Series</a> and managed only a walk. Mulipola currently ranks as the second best fielding catcher and overall player for the Wildcats in school history with a .996 <a href="fielding%20percentage">fielding percentage</a>.
Team USA.
Mulipola returned to Arizona for the <a href="2021%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20softball%20season">2021 season</a>, after missing the <a href="2021%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20softball%20season">2020 season</a> due to the Stand Beside Her Tour with USA Softball in preparation for the <a href="2020%20Summer%20Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a>. At the Olympics, Mulipola played in one game collecting a hit and walk. Mulipola did not play in the gold medal game, where Team USA was defeated by <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20softball%20team">Team Japan</a> 2–0.
